the configs are in many files instead of one for some programs
yes, but programs handle the configuration files
Ubuntu has little to do with that
it isn't like in Windows, where there is one huge Registry with most programs' configuration

well, I guess I don't know.  most services get their own directory to keep them together
it's not the same as a jail
so in BSD you don't have to forward the /dev and all that/
you can mount /dev and other things inside the jail
or "bind"
but a jail is really a whole another system why a chroot is a "half" system since it doesn't have it's own ip address
